oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mel Tillis Live at Colonie Hill - 1978-07-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Colonie Hill live show. The tape features a live performance of Mel Tillis (musician). The Colonie Hill live show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Mel Tillis is from July 21, 1978.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mel Tillis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Larry Kenny introduces Mel Tillis -- (00:21) Everyone Needs Someone (Mel Tillis) -- (02:22) Good Woman Blues (Mel Tillis) -- (03:51)) I Got the Hoss (Mel Tillis) -- (07:30) West Bound Trains (Mel Tillis) -- (10:26) Ain't No California (Mel Tillis) -- (14:03) Crazy Arms (Mel Tillis) -- (17:51) I Can't Stop Loving You (Mel Tillis) -- (19:03) Orange Blossom Special [instrumental] (Mel Tillis) -- (21:49) Tillis discusses how this is his first visit to New Jersey, and Tillis jokes about his stuttering -- (26:06) All the Way Out in the Middle of the Floor (Mel Tillis) -- (26:33) Tillis jokes about his band going through changes -- (28:16) Who's Julie (Mel Tillis) -- (30:26) Tillis uses an impression to jokingly discuss with himself -- (35:04) Who's Julie [excerpt] (Mel Tillis) -- (35:35) Tillis praises O'Dell Martin -- (36:23) Unidentified guitar tune (O'Dell Martin) -- (38:37) Mr. Sandman [instrumental] (O'Dell Martin) -- (39:56) Tillis introduces an unidentified male -- (40:57) Uncle Pen (Mel Tillis) -- (43:18) Tillis discusses the time where he had the opportunity to record with Bob Wills -- (45:46) Faded Love (Mel Tillis) -- (48:36) Tillis reflects on his bassist bringing him a song -- (50:23) I Believe in You (Mel Tillis) -- (52:51) An unidentified host interrupts the show to present Tillis with an award -- (56:23) Unidentified tune (Mel Tillis) -- (58:19) Tillis jokes about a female vocalist -- (1:06:18) Ruby Don't Take Your Love to Town (Mel Tillis) -- (1:08:15) Tillis jokes about being a stuttering pilot -- (1:12:02) Detroit City (Mel Tillis) -- (1:15:42) Unidentified fiddle tune [featuring Larry Kenny outro voiceover] (Mel Tillis) -- (1:16:44) When I Stop Leaving (I'll be Gone) [excerpt] (Charley Pride)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Tillis, Mel;
